snippet.title: Your weekend guide to Corbould Park races
snippet.content: The Sunshine Coast Turf Club hosts a nine-race program this Sunday. The track is rated a Good 4 with the rail is out 7m. Race 1: Knockoura (7) ran on well to just miss the win over 1400m last start. The rise in distance suits. Emperor's Beach (4) is drawn to get a better run than last start where he was a close second. One Man Grand (9) ran on strongly for third this course and distance last start. Race 2: Expat Envy (1) has been racing in great form in this class. He can control things in front. Subsolar (6) will be fitter after just missing the win over this distance last start. Mr Cha Cha (2) will appreciate racing on a drier surface and has a good record here. Race 3: Maxwell (1) hit the line strongly over 950m at Moree when resuming. The rise in distance suits. See Miracles (9) ran well in a stronger maiden last start and is ideally drawn. Tipsy (13) will be improved after running on first up. Race 4: Sequalo's Spirit (6) was solid when finishing third on debut. The addition of blinkers and the inside gate are positives. The Real Spiel (5) resumes following a very good trial win. Bia Tyche (10) will appreciate the extra distance after running on well last start. Race 5: Muddy Rope (3) finished a narrow second over this course and distance last start. He'll be fitter and could prove hard to catch. Raja Ampat (1) will find this easier than recent city class races. Damn Fine (4) found the line strongly when resuming in a stronger grade. Race 6: Budget Bender (1) won at Ipswich over 1700m last start. He can control the speed and be hard to run down. Topending (4) will appreciate getting out in distance. Bold Heart (5) disappointed last start but on best form can feature. Race 7: The King's Widow (10) looks set to run well on debut following two very good trial wins. Bimini Road (8) has run well in two trials leading into her first start. Stella's Dream (1) resumes here following a very good last preparation. Race 8: Valleseco (5) resumes here following a good trial win. He won over this course and distance first up last preparation. Mishani Fernando (1) won well on debut at Doomben. Coochin Boy (4) was a dominant winner here when resuming. Race 9: Thornett (3) ran on strongly to just miss the win when resuming. The extra distance suits. Zoff Of The World (2) can improve with blinkers following a fair first up run. Rock On Destiny (1) will appreciate dropping in grade. Form comment provided by Puntersland, powered by Racing Queensland. Visit facebook.com/Puntersland, or follow @Puntersland via Twitter. The words "hustler!" and "bitch!" were hurled. Celebs are bravely stepping into the Kitchen with Marco Pierre White Caloundra Chorale and Theatre Co is gearing up for The Secret Garden Box of Birds art exhibition is coming to Art Nuvo, Buderim Seclusion without isolation on magical 31ha Noosa holding House and island for $3,500,000 Key buildings and international interest set to be revealed Check out this weekend's homes open for inspection.
